embeds.title: Silent 1
embeds.description:
Act 1 Boss

**Warning: Highly Toxic** - Poison :p_poison: is blockable and deals damage at end of turn. Receive an Antidote at the start of combat.

**Cards**: Crippling Cloud, Survivor, Burst, Poison :p_poison:ed Stab, Dodge and Roll, Strike, Bane(+), Defend, Deflect, Footwork, Noxious Fumes, Deadly Poison :p_poison:

**Relics**: Horn Cleat, Twisted Funnel, Lantern (A19)

**Unique Cards**:
Antidote - Lose all Poison :p_poison:.

messages.content: antidote always being there turn 1 is great if and only if for the fact that you start poisoned
save your <potion upgrade all cards> for this fight, as upgrading antidote helps a LOT (makes it 0 cost)

embeds.title: Blessing of the Forge
embeds.description:
Common Potion / All / Slay the Spire

**Upgrade** all cards in your hand for the rest of combat.

footer.text: <potion upgrade all cards> = blessing of the forge, 77% sure

messages.content: uhhh not that

embeds.description:

For each Ignited Ghostflame, **Upgrade** a random card in your hand.

messages.content: Realistically you want to play your antidote every time you see it
and that lets you
<Recover> is also INSANELY good in this fight

embeds.title: Recover
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 5 (8) **Block** :p_block:.
**Brace** 3 (4).
Place a card from your discard pile into **Stasis.**

messages.content: this card + enough accelerate can mean effectively hard countering her
<reroute> helps a lot as well

embeds.title: Reroute
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 9 (12) damage.
Place the next card you play this turn into **Stasis.**
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: In general stasis letting you decide to some extent what turn you'll get it AND get some cards out of your draw pile so you can get it sooner
yeah
Hmmm what other character specific stuff is there
Auto can just thin down their deck really well.
Champ is Champ
Hexa can also thin down their deck hard
So the characters that struggle with it are gremlins snecko and slime?
Snecko probably not
as they have EVERYTHING that can help
I would say gremlins and slime
Slime after splitting will have a thinner draw pile, but usually you won't have a lick draw engine set up at that point of the game

The main things you want for this fight are a smaller deck size so that you draw antidote more often, a little bit of card draw, maybe some more cheap 0 cost cards so that you can still be proactive while casting antidote. You can also win with a reasonably good block engine, since the poison can be blocked while you wait to draw antidote. Taking a few less cards from card reward screens is helpful for everyone, especially if it would increase the amount of time before your first reshuffle (so your 21st card or 16th card in most decks). Not generally a very scary boss fight, I think most characters can handle blocking the poison well enough and wait for antidote to come around. On slime boss, prioritizing the blocking slime is solid, on gremlins, look for bubble barrier, infinite wards, and other ways to stall and block a bit better.
Isn't there a gremlins power that gives artifact after using 7 attacks?

embeds.title: Makeshift Armor
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_gremlin: / The Gremlins / Downfall

 (Gain 1 **Artifact** :p_artifact:.)
Every time you play 7 attacks, gain 1 **Artifact** :p_artifact:.

embeds.title: Ancient Construct
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 :e_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

 (Gain 2 **Artifact** :p_artifact:.)
At the start of your turn, if you have no **Artifact** :p_artifact:, gain 1 **Artifact** :p_artifact:.

messages.content: I think ancient construct is meh. It should technically help out more but usually the way I play it is from putting it in stasis. If you draw it turn 1 as well as a way to put it into stasis, then you play it turn 5. Pretty sure that it will already have played noxious fumes, so you'll only be blocking 2 poison.
wait would it?
<noxious fumes>

embeds.title: Noxious Fumes
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_green: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

At the start of your turn, apply 2 (3) Poison :p_poison: to ALL enemies.

messages.content: So at the start of silent's turn.
end
Wait it does it at the end of silent's turn?
yes
including the turn she plays it
Huh. So I guess Ancient Construct might help.
I still don't think it's worth it to take in act 1, but if you got it from floor0 Neow it can help out.
Silent 1 feels like the hardest bossfight for me because I have a bad habit of taking lots of cards early that can "solve everything" and focusing on synergies late act 1-early act 2
so i never get antidote when i need it
Silent 1 feels like the easiest to me. It's actually got counterplay to its gimmick, which IC1 and Defect 1 don't.
And also having less cards overall does help, and being encouraged to take less cards is nice.
I also have a bad habit of taking card draw only when i desperately need it, never beforehand

If I had to rank act 1 bosses in order of difficulty then probably
5. Silent
4. Hermit?
3. Watcher
2. IC
1. Defect
i think hermit is harder than watcher imo
once she starts to hit hard, you should have some sort of block/scaling engine going
With watcher you either need massive burst or hard scaling
All of Hermit's scaling can be stopped
And thar burst really is massive. I've lost a lot of good decks because I was unable to get the insane damage to get through <halt>

messages.content: None of Watcher's scaling can be stopped
wait that's not it
first try
also wrath + wallop
Yeah. It also makes you very susceptible to low rolls.
Overall I think watcher 1 and defect 1 are my least favorite act 1 fights design wise.
Defect feels boring AND super strong. Watcher makes that first turn where you activate wrath really matter because she may just end up getting 30 block and threatening 30 damage next turn
or something ludicrous like that
The only positive thing about defect 1 is that I can use it to prove beyond a reasonable doubt that <Sunder> is great

If this kills an enemy, gain :e_blue: :e_blue: :e_blue:.

messages.content: because I have a friend who thinks sunder is shit
Sunder just is great. Your friend is wrong and dumb and should feel bad.
problem is I couldn't exactly prove that to them

Overall if I had to rate how well designed each boss is (ignoring how strong it actually is, but how fun it is to fight and how unique it is)

5. IC
4. Defect
3. Watcher
2. Hermit
1. Silent
wow it's almost reverse
it's literally reversed

no defect and ic swapped

also has very reliable Weak
because of <Champion's Belt> + <Thunderclap>

embeds.title: Ironclad 1
embeds.description:
Act 1 Boss

**Synchronize** - Whenever Ironclad generates a **Status** card, a duplicate is added into your discard pile.

**Cards**: Bash, Flawed, Doubt, Reckless Charge, Wild Strike(+), Defend, Power Through, Second Wind, Seeing Red, Immolate, Icky, True Grit+, Thunderclap+, Feel No Pain

**Relics**: Art of War, Champion's Belt, Orichalcum (A19)

embeds.title: Thunderclap
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_red: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Deal 4 (7) damage and apply 1 **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable: to ALL enemies.

messages.content: Defect is just not unique at all (I feel like IC1 should be the status boss since IC has a status build when defect doesn't) and the turns where it threatens 24 damage and then voids you is annoying.
I guess my issue with hermit1 is dying on turn 3 because i dont have enough block

Watcher has the aforementioned problems and I don't think it is good design, I just think IC and Defect suck more.

she's like an earlier Champ
which is funny
given what Champ is like as a character
IC sucks how Time Eater sucks, but Defect sucks because Void sucks
Yes but before you really have the time to actually get a scaling engine.
Time Eater?
And also champ doesn't throw up 30 block randomly while still threatening 30 damage
I think IC 1 is a pain in the dick because not only does he throw lots of junk in your deck, but he just outputs a lot of damage and block as well
and it's a bit hard to change that
as status gen cards are balanced by giving them inflated values to compensate for the statuses
I think its one of those things where Time Eater is really frusturating and unfun, but not "unfair"
I feel like perhaps replacing <Immolate> with <Fire Breathing> might help?

messages.content: I think IC is lame and hard, but not as awful as Defect
I think Hermit is just lame

Hermit is cool and I like how there are options to defense, but it feels very snowbally. If you can't stop the first strength gain it makes every single turn threaten more damage (except for obviously the turn where it doesn't attack) meaning you need to block more and can't focus as much on attacking.
I think Watcher is just hard

also there's an actual term for this feeling
I think Defect is fucking brain-melting
it's called "unstable equilibrium"

I think maybe if hermit was maybe reversed? So if you deal 15+ damage then it activates dead on? So you aren't incentivized to just hit it hard every single turn like you currently are, and you can choose what dead on effects it will get.
I just dont think stopping any other Dead-On except Bullseye does enough to warrant attacking over blocking
not even the dive+?
or the headshot?
Dive+ activates when hes not attacking
so theres no point in blocking
attacking means it does less damage for 2 of the turns.
"it"?
Idk I just use random pronouns for characters.
The headshot is okay, not a massive threat, but okay, on turn1 i focus the louse with aoe, and if i cant, i knock out dead-on
I don't think hermit is gonna get mad at me for calling it an it
Honestly i think the worst part about H1 is the fact that it really sucks against mainly Hexa, so im probably biased

embeds.title: Ignore Pain
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 2 (1) :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Your HP cannot be reduced until your next turn.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: I really like this interaction

Ironclad 1 is an absolutely brutal fight, so much damage coming in so fast, and heavy junking from their statuses. It also blocks for large amounts, making bursting it down pretty difficult. That fight is easily my most feared boss in act 1. Silent 1 is pretty easy in comparison, the antidote is just very helpful to counter it. Perhaps I find ironclad difficult because it punishes thin decks, and silent easy because it rewards those same thin decks?
Yeah and overall I've found thin decks to be more consistent.
I think that defect 1's current implementation is a little boring, and I want to see it reworked
maybe i just take too many cards in act 1
because IC 1 never really hurts me as much
I build medium size decks
so I don't get especially hurt or helped by IC 1 or Silent 1
I think that a cool defect fight rework (would take a decent amount of effort) would be to axe current defect 1 and rework the claw defect with more of a 0 cost deck (all for one).
I don't feel like AFO would be able to work properly with the current charboss format
typically i end act 1 with a 15-20 card deck and creep it up to 30 if it seems necessary (hexa ghost shield spam, lick spam)
Yeah that's my current fear, since I think if it did work it would already be there.
man if taking cards from discard pile worked, I feel like all the defect bosses would have <Hologram>
